value.name: Closing Arguments Delivered In Jay Anderson John Doe Hearing
value.description: Attorney Kimberley Motley, who represents the Anderson family, noted that Jay Anderson himself was the most important witness.

value.name: Judge Deciding Whether To Charge Cop For Justified Shooting Has Ex-Wife Who Represented Dead Suspect’s Family
value.description: The ex-wife of the Milwaukee County judge tasked with deciding whether or not a former Wauwatosa police officer will face charges for a fatal officer-involved shooting is also an attorney who has represented the family of the suspect the officer killed.

value.name: Closing Arguments Delivered On Jay Anderson’s Killing
value.description: Jay Anderson Sr. (left) and Linda Anderson (right), the parents of Jay Anderson Jr. Photo by Isiah Holmes/Wisconsin Examiner. Judge Glenn Yamahiro heard closing arguments Wednesday in the John Doe hearing into the killing of Jay Anderson,

value.name: A judge will decide whether to charge ex-Wauwatosa Police Officer Joseph Mensah in the 2016 shooting death of Jay Anderson Jr.
value.description: Joseph Mensah was cleared by the Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office five years ago in a fatal shooting. Now, a judge will make the decision.

value.name: Wauwatosa's police chief claims Jay Anderson Jr. 'was armed' before he was fatally shot by an officer five years ago
value.description: After originally trying to quash a subpoena, Wauwatosa Police Chief Barry Weber appeared in Milwaukee County Court on Tuesday for a hearing related to the 2016 fatal shooting of Jay Anderson Jr ...

value.name: Families Gather To Remember Loved Ones Killed During Interactions With Milwaukee-Area Police
value.description: Sunday afternoon in Milwaukee, about a dozen local Black families whose loved ones died during interactions with police gathered at Washington Park to remember those who passed away.

value.name: Mensah Duty Fitness Improperly Evaluated after Shooting: Expert
value.description: Third and final Jay Anderson John Doe hearing reveals numerous inconsistencies and questionable actions by Wauwatosa Police Department.

value.name: Wauwatosa police chief forced to testify about Joseph Mensah
value.description: HILLARY: THE FAMILY OF JAY ANDERSON SAYS WAUWATOSA POLICE INTERFERE WITH MILWAUKEE POLICE’S INVESTIGATION OF HIS SHOOTING MULTIPLE TIMES. AND THEY BELIEVE CHIEF BARRY WEBER DO EVERYTHING THAT ...

value.name: 'Remember Their Names' rally takes place in Washington Park

value.name: Suburban Milwaukee police officer who fatally shot 3 since 2015 resigns
value.description: Mensah was suspended by the Wauwatosa Police and Fire Commission after a complaint was filed by the family of one of the men he killed, Jay Anderson Jr. He was shot after Mensah found him sitting ...

value.name: Can body cameras deliver justice for those killed by police?
value.description: When Joel Acevedo died from injuries at the hands of an off-duty Milwaukee police officer last spring, his parents, Maribel and José, were told their son had been the aggressor.

value.name: Wisconsin police chief sees no reason officer who killed teen should be fired
value.description: In 2016, he shot Jay Anderson Jr. in a car parked in a park after hours after he said he thought he saw Anderson reaching for a gun on the passenger seat. He was cleared in both instances.

value.name: Musicians, residents rejoice at lifted New Orleans mask mandate; businesses a little more cautious
value.description: We’ve grown accustomed to the no shoes, no masks, no service way of life, but now masks are no longer required in New Orleans.
